thread.title: US wholesale inventories beat expectations in June
thread.title_full: US wholesale inventories beat expectations in June

title: US wholesale inventories beat expectations in June
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Tue, Aug 11, 2015, 17:01 BST - UK Markets closed US wholesale inventories beat expectations in June By Daniel Cancian | Sharecast – 1 minute 10 seconds ago 278.35 -4.2500 
LONDON (ShareCast) - (ShareCast News) - US wholesale inventories rose above expectations in June, figures released on Tuesday showed. According to the Commerce Department, wholesale inventories climbed 0.9% month-on-month in June from a downwardly revised 0.6% in the previous month and compared with analysts' expectations of a 0.4% reading. 
The increase was driven by a gain in motor vehicle and motor vehicle parts and supplies, which jumped 2%, offseting a 2.1% decline in computer and computer peripheral equipment and software. 
Analysts at Barclays (LSE: BARC.L - news ) indicated their second quarter GDP estimate fell 0.1% to 2.9%, as the revised path for non-automotive wholesale inventories through June remains below the Bureau of Economic Analysis' assumptions incorporated in the advanced estimate of GDP. 
However, the stronger-than-expected reading boosted their forecast for Thursday's release of June business inventories to 0.4% month-on-month from 0.3%.
